sentences: Küll on kasimata suuga mees, katsuks laste kuuldeski suud kasida!
Pesemata suuga eit ei valinud sõnu.
context: The word 'suud' is the partitive singular form of 'suu' (mouth), meaning 'with/using a mouth'. It typically appears in phrases like 'kasimata suuga' (with an unwashed mouth) or 'pesemata suuga' (with an unwashed/dirty mouth). These expressions are used to describe someone who speaks crudely, uses foul language, or has poor hygiene. The word carries negative connotations related to both physical cleanliness and verbal decency.
